reviews:
Zuerst das negative, das Holster hat den Namen Holster bei einer 100€TaLa nicht verdient.
Ich empfehle das Holster von Wuben, das passt perfekt und ist wesentlich hochwertiger.
Die Lampe selbst überzeugt mit enormer Leistung und Ausdauer.
Anodisierung ist perfekt.
Druckpunkt beider Schalter ebenso.
Der Akku mit 5000mah ist etwas größer als ein normaler 21700,in meine Ladestation passt er leider nicht, aber zum Glück kann man die Lampe selbst über USB C aufladen

reviews:
Klein, stark, handlich. Zuerst war ich überrascht, wie klein die Lampe ist, aber dann restlos von der Leistung überzeugt.
Der Lichtstrahl ist etwas breiter, daher leuchtet sie nicht so weit und so grell wie andere Lampen, dafür hat sie aber eine sehr schöne Ausleuchtung der Umgebung und ein angenehmes Licht. Ideal für Wanderungen und bei Reparaturen. Was nutzt mir 400 m Reichweite, wenn der Strahl nur blendet und einen Leuchtkreis von 2-3 m abdeckt?

reviews: I purchased this flashlight while in the USA. We travel a lot so having a good quality flashlight is paramount. We left the product in its original package as we headed to the South Pacific. Upon arrival we removed the protective tab and left the flashlight on charge for 24 hours. Sadly the light did not work. My husband is a mechanic and noted the battery was not at all charged. We contacted the company via email and phone, but they have not responded at all!!! Ver very disappointing. So there goes $100+ dollars down the toilet. I do not at all recommend this company or any of their products due to horrible customer service.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: So far it seems good but I just had a different Fenix flashlight quit working that was nearly new and hardly used. so now I have to spend money to send it to Fenix after paying $60 and basically getting to use it maybe like 7 times, it was the model RC05, lets just hope that warrante department treats me right, and lets hope that this model pd36r does too or I will be done with Fenix, out of 8 different flashlights I own it doesn't show well when the second most expensive one from a top maker quits with nearly no use, and a couple cheap china mades are going strong after several years of hard abuse. so you caught me at a bad time to ask what I think.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews:
Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight.
I love flashlights - don't know why. I attach a lanyard to each new one and string it from a peg hanger with all the others. I like being able to instantly grab one, race outside and blast light on something needing immediate attention. And I want to see very well when the object is close, the far side of the lawn or across the street. I HATE clicking a flashlight and getting very dim or no light at all when new batteries were added a few weeks earlier.
This is the best I've used. I received it July 1 and it took longer than I expected for a 1st time charge - maybe a couple of days. But the brightness and distance are amazing. The Fenix website says the turbo setting output is 1600 lumens at just over 900 feet - I haven't measured but that seems right. it is very bright. Per Fenix, it’s waterproof for 30 mins under water 6 feet deep and drop proof from 5 feet. I've used it a number of times at turbo - and for about 45 mins on a middle setting and the battery indicator shows still strong. The body does get hot quickly on turbo – but that’s normal LED heat dissipation in aluminum.
The one thing I’d like it doesn’t have is a turbo brightness setting with a very narrow beam. But this is my first Fenix and I’ll look for that next time. I highly recommend this one.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: This flashlight is awesome! Love the brightness and battery life out of this thing! It has everything I wanted in an EDC light: deep pocket carry, strike bezel, high lumen output, great tactical button!
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: Does what it says and does it well.
reviews:
Does all the description says. Very bright. I like the “single step” to turn on the strobe effect. I use the strobe to discourage the skunks in the neighborhood when walking the dog at night. I wanted it more to protect against coyotes from a nearby golf course but luckily haven’t had that opportunity.
I do wish the light also had a focus ring like many other bright led flashlights but you can’t fit everything into a small, sleek and powerful light. The usb C charging is also very convenient. Darned expensive tho.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: Brighter than my pd35. Everytime you activate the light a green or red light appears on the 2ndary button alerting you to battery health, super helpful. Not having to buy a new recharging station for the 21700 batteries is my favorite part even though the light is pricier.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: This is the second Fenix I’ve bought this year. This one for my girlfriend. It’s brighter than my TK20R that puts out 1,000 lumen but I like the tighter beam on my TK20R as i use it to spot voles, raccoons, opossums, snakes, and anything else slithering around my place in the night, while this light is perfect for her to flood a larger area to detect any boogie men lurking when she goes out at night. I use mine more than 2 hours every night continuously with medium beam, turbo for a couple of min when I’ve spotted a critter I want to watch. I’ve dropped it several times and it’s still great. Wish I’d bought one years ago. I recharge after each prolonged use when i come in every night. Best lights I’ve ever seen, no question about that.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I haven't had a chance to try this out in a functional situation yet, but in my testing the light has been very bright, with a very durable construction. I am particularly fond of the separate operating buttons, where the rear button only turns the light on or off, with the side button operating the various modes. The battery seems ok so far, but as mentioned I haven't had it long enough to notice issues. I will mention that the light gets a bit warm when charging via USB-C. I don't have an external battery charger yet, so I'll need to keep an eye on this to see if it develops into an issue. So far though, just warmer than expected, not too warm to cause issues.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: Best Self Defense Flashlight for Office Professionals
reviews:
I bought this flashlight mostly to be a self-defense weapon that I can carry anywhere, including in a medical office setting. I also wanted one that was useful for other lighting tasks. So, I needed something really powerful, that can fit in a dress shirt pocket, and not look too much like a weapon.

High lumens are important, but not the only factor that makes a flashlight effective for self defense. It also needs to focus the light into a bright spot. This light has a smooth deep reflector that does just that. The spot is also wide enough to cover an attacker's entire visual field. The color of the light adds to its intensity.

The length is not too long, and not too short. If stand the light straight up in my shirt pocket, it does protrude above the pocket a little. If I let it slip diagonally, It is pretty much concealed, and no one has commented on it. When I grasp it in my palm, it extends an inch and a half from the side of my hand. That is the perfect size for a striking weapon.

It's a pretty light, with the smooth black finish and gold side switch. It has a serrated bezel that makes it an effective striking or scraping weapon. It does not have aggressive crenellation, that can ruin a pocket or scare the staff if pull it out for other uses. The knurling consists of horizontal grooves, which is the most effective pattern to prevent it from slipping out of my hand if I do strike with it.

A classic recommendation for a self defense flashlight is that the operation is simple, and it will turn on at the greatest intensity, with a focused spot and not accidentally slip into non fighting modes like SOS or low light. One strategy is a light that only has one mode, and no variable focus. Then the light is only effective for self dense or seeing long distances. Other lights have multiple modes, and come on at the brightest mode, but if you hit the switch again, it will switch to the lowest intensity. Some lights have complicated programs, to make it turn on and stay in the desired mode. This light simply turns on in the mode it was last on, and unless you hit the side switch, it will not go into other modes. If you hold the side switch down, It will go into an irregular strobe pattern that is really disorienting.

Boy, this has been a long review. I hope it is useful to someone.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: this is not worth 100 dollars in my opinion. i think Astrolux makes 2 nicer lights at half the price. very bright and the deer i spotted at 60 yards were a little embarrassed! i wouldn't buy it again, personally, but it is ok. One thing i didn't like. the side switch is pretty flat and with gloves or without gloves, i couldn't find it quickly when i wanted to. I do like having the end switch and the side switch.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews:
I own multiple Fenix flashlights. They never disappoint and this is no exception. With the 21700 cell, the runtime on bright modes is great. I have pocket carried this and it is not too cumbersome. I would carry the E30R for frequently though.
When on turbo setting the light does get hot, but I appreciate that the heat does not transfer to much the grip.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

review_title: You get what you pay for.
reviews: It’s a very good flashlight, I work as security in the night so when I need to see in dark areas it lights it up like it was almost day light. It’s helpful also to point it at people and see what they have on them from a distance instead of having to get close to them. The strobe is also handy for when you need to flag down certain people. Also, one thing you guys can use it for is to blind people temporarily if they ever come charging at you. It’s a good product In my opinion.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: The Fenix pd36r is one awesome edc flashlight. I have owned numerous flashlights in this price range and category and the pd36r truly outshines them all (no pun intended). Very durable and lightweight light. The battery life is amazing for the super bright output. Shipping from Amazon was quick and easy as usual. I will continue to purchase quality affordable products from fenix.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews:
The brightness is pretty good on a fully charged battery, but be aware that it cannot maintain its full brightness for very long; the brightness drops to perhaps half its maximum rating within minutes.

Overall I'd say it's decent if you can keep it fully charged, though given its rapid brightness drop I have to wonder if it's really worth the $100 or so.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: Nothing to dislike thus far. You often get what you pay up for and this flashlight will LIGHT IT UP! With it's multiple selections to conserve power or really brighten a dark area, it's GREAT! I'm an over the road owner owner operator and this will be used extensively for my early morning, late night inspections. Thanks for an awesome product delivered in a timely manner!
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: I had another flashlight by Fenix before, and it was great. Although I only have about 6 hours of use with this light, I expect nothing less than greatness. The light comes ready to go, but I topped it off on the charger before use. It is plenty bright, and I often don't get anywhere near turbo mode (1600 lumens) with normal use. While using this light at it's more reasonable settings, it will last you a few nights without needing to charge.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer

reviews: Excellent light with impressive construction and features. Strong battery life, easy output adjustments. Incredible light throw for a small, portable light. Great for emergencies since it can be charged off of a solar panel or car USB.

review_title: Is there such thin as too bright?
reviews: This thing is sweet, very well built. Charged up in about 2 hours from shipping. And this thing is bright. In my backyard it was almost too bright. Throws light very far. Turbo setting great for open large areas where you need to search. Wish that the Eco mode was just a bit dinner. 30lm still too bright for very low light situation! We will see how well this thing holds up. Will update after a few months of use!
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen USB-C Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight with Fenix Battery and LumenTac Battery Organizer
